name: JAWS
description:
'''JAWS''' were an English [[Indie rock|indie]] rock band formed in [[Birmingham]], England in 2012 after singer Connor Schofield had posted a demo (Cameron) online that received enough positive feedback to encourage him to start a band with friends from [[Halesowen College of Further Education|Halesowen College]]. They have often been identified as part of the [[Digbeth]]-based [[B-Town]] scene.

JAWS have published two [[Extended play|EP]]s and three full length [[LP record|LPs]] so far. The B-side of "Surround You"â€”"Stay In" featuring on the Ubisoft game Rocksmith 2014. "Gold" was featured in an episode of [[Hollyoaks]]. They have toured with [[The Twang]], [[Peace (band)|Peace]], [[Swim Deep]], [[Spector (band)|Spector]] as well as various support slots.

In December 2013, the band announced via their Facebook page that they would be recording a full studio album in 2014 partially funded by the PRS. In April, they released the single "Think Too Much, Feel Too Little".

In June 2014, the band announced their debut album "Be Slowly" would be released on 15 September that year. The band announced over Twitter a tour in September, stopping at Birmingham, Newcastle, Glasgow and plenty more, supported by Fickle Friends, Milk Teeth and Brawlers.

On 27 April 2015, JAWS shared the standalone single "Bad Company" via Huw Stephens Radio 1 show.
